page.title: 01Peter Tavy and its locale
page.content: This area is a rural area in Devon.It is between Okehampton and Tavistock. The nearest town is Tavistock and it is on the edge of Dartmoor.The main river flowing through the area is the Tavy and the tributaries are Wallabrook near Tavistock and Collybrook which flows through Peter Tavy.The largest settlement is Peter Tavy but there are other houses along the main roads and even a few on the narrower roads The main road is the A386 from Callington to Okehampton. There are also other roads which are narrow and winding and generally less than 4 metres wide. There is one day prep. school called St. Michael's and one boarding school for boys over 11 called Kelly College. There are no state schools. There are two inns, one in Peter Tavy.
